definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: He looks like a child and not a business man.
sentences.chinese: 呵呵，看來他還童心未泯，比我還小孩子氣。

sentences.english: Hareton grew black as a thunder cloud, at this childish speech.
sentences.chinese: 哈里頓聽了這一套孩子氣的話，臉像陰雲一般黑。

sentences.english: You should not behave childishly at your age.
sentences.chinese: 在你這個年齡做事不應該孩子氣。

sentences.english: That was sort of a juvie thing to do.
sentences.chinese: 幹出那種事似乎有些孩子氣。

sentences.english: He didn't care her childishness and continue say of patience.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有在意她的孩子氣，繼續耐心的說。

sentences.english: Perhaps you will be angry, i was kind of childishness.
sentences.chinese: 也許你會很生氣，我有點孩子氣。

sentences.english: My dear child, you're being childish.
sentences.chinese: 我的乖孩子，你這是孩子氣。

sentences.english: Of course, this just makes her look more childish.
sentences.chinese: 當然，這個動作只會讓她看起來更加孩子氣。

sentences.english: Don't be so childish if you think you can get something for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 別這麼孩子氣，如果你認爲你能夠不勞而獲。

sentences.english: Yeah, it turns out the nation's mental-health leaders act like children.
sentences.chinese: 原來這個國家的精神健康的先驅們這麼孩子氣。

sentences.english: Grace, one of her colleagues, thinks that Elle is very childish.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉的同事格蕾斯覺得艾莉太孩子氣了。

sentences.english: A: Behave yourself, Tom. Don’t be so childish.
sentences.chinese: 規矩點兒，湯姆，別這麼孩子氣。

sentences.english: What we need to learn from children isn't childish.
sentences.chinese: 我們要從孩子身上學的並非是孩子氣。

sentences.english: There even remained in his remoter crannies some relics of the boy.
sentences.chinese: 從某些細微之處還隱約可見他還保留着幾分孩子氣。

sentences.english: I like him all the more because he is so childish.
sentences.chinese: 正因爲他有孩子氣我更加喜歡他。

sentences.english: Shaped out of great lumps of muck by childish gods.
sentences.chinese: 定是被孩子氣的神靈用泥巴塑造。

definition: now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
lit. love the house and its crow (idiom); involvement with sb and everyone connected/Love me, love my dog.
to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
